turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Why you gotta say a thing like that.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: I'm just saying.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Why you gotta. We were gonna give you a ride someplace, man. Now I just don't know.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: I'm just talking.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Fuck your hot chocolate, Rudy.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: For twenty-five, she sounds pretty mature.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Yeah. You grow up in Detroit, you get matured real quick.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: What if she sees you, man, sees what you look like... and it's not there. You just don't do it for her.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Me and her got a connection.  Read this part. Read the part about stuffing her stocking.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: She's using a new perfume.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: No, I think that's just oranges. She writes here she's eating oranges.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Shoulda written to that magazine, Rudy. I'm gonna walk outta here, walk right into a relationship. Not some one-nighter, man... a relationship. You? You're gonna walk outta here with bus fare. Searching for the drunkest skirt in the room.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Mornin', gorgeous. More egg nog?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Shoulda written, Rudy...

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: All I want... is to make it to Sidnaw, and sit down for Christmas dinner. Watch some ball with my old man, sleep in my old bed, and have leftovers for bout six months.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Thought you hated Sidnaw.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Just taste that Christmas turkey.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Thought you hate your old man.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Five years, Nicky. Five years.  I just want to go home.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Don't look like he missed the sunlight.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Pinscher told me Alamo thinks I'm the one ratted on him beating up Cree. Since I was there, I saw it, he thinks I got him sent to solitary.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Aw, Rudy.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: So maybe after our week beneath the sheets, we'll head down to Motor City for New Year's. She says her roommate's skipping town for a few days, have the place to ourselves. Remember how her brother's a truck driver down there? I'm thinking he might be able to help get me some work.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: What, working security?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: No, I'm through with that shit. Ashley's right. Gotta start doing something I got a stake in. Get a business going.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: I don't know, I've seen the business world.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Hotwiring cars, Rudy, does not qualify as a small business. Chop shop consultant; doesn't work on a resume.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Just a roach, Zook.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Good for you. Protein.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Rudy, don't move --

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Two days, we got two days! Don't do nothing. Don't touch nothing --

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Don't move, Rudy!

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Standing right here, man!

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: GUARD! GUARD!

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Alamo...

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: GUARD!!!

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Jesus, Rudy --

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Take it, man! You're all right! Hold it in! GUARD!

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Oh, fuck, Rudy... oh Jesus...

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: GUARD!!!

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Ash... Ashley...

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: No, man! No, no, no!

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Tell her... I'll be there ...

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: You're GONNA be there! We're getting outta here! TAKE IT!

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Tell Ashley... I...

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: YOU TELL HER!

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: ...be with her...

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: NO!!!

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: ...for Christmas...

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: NICK!!!

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Millie here used to serve drinks to these gunrunning truckers, real big talkers, talking bout a real score one day. I was in the Mountain, man, what the hell, why not let her get friendly with 'em? Let her tell 'em an idea she had, 'bout writing guys in prison. Getting one who could show 'em a sure thing.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: She set them up. All of them.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Why not have her pretend to find me? Pretend to write me and reel me in? Tell her new trucker-man she'd pose as some sister of his named Ashley?

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: And you set me up.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Always wanted to rob that casino, Rudy. Way back when I worked there. What better way than to get some guys to rob it for me.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Paid the Alamo ten bucks to put the shiv in me. He's a lifer, what does he care. Paid a hospital guard fifty to put out the story I was dead. Once the wound healed up...  Got out of the Mountain this morning. And tonight I'm a rich man.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: How'd you know I'd do it.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Do what?

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Walk outta there and tell her I was you.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Hell, you never needed to convince Ashley you were me. Just the dumb fucking truckers. I figured I'd talked enough about the Tomahawk in the pen for you to get by --

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Talked about the old man's weapons stash, probably forgot I'd remember

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Hm. Well. They'd have killed you if you weren't me, Rudy. We knew you'd start convincing 'em soon enough.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: They had the weapons and the willpower. We just gave them their inside man.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: You gave them me.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I gave them me.  Said some nice things about me, Rudy. I appreciate it. But don't worry. I do love her. And she loves me. You had that right all along.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: That was my card, pop! My card! You hit for my card!

turns.speaker: OLD TIMER
turns.text: I... sorry, Mister...

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: That was my king!

turns.speaker: OLD TIMER
turns.text: Well...sorry...

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: POP! That was My card!

turns.speaker: OLD TIMER
turns.text: But... I had a five...

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: You're hitting for MY cards!

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Switch seats with me.

turns.speaker: OLD TIMER
turns.text: What? No...

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: You're taking my money. Switch seats with me. Switch seats with me if you're not taking my money --

turns.speaker: OLD TIMER
turns.text: I'm ninety-two years old --

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Then get yourself another table! You're hitting Santa's cards and you're taking Santa's money!

turns.speaker: OLD TIMER
turns.text: There is no other table --

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: THEY'LL OPEN ONE!

turns.speaker: PUG
turns.text: Watch your mouth, man. It's Christmas.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: I'M NOT NICK!

turns.speaker: PUG
turns.text: Start talkin

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Who the hell made this map.

turns.speaker: PUG
turns.text: That's what it looks like!

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Since when? What the hell is this room?

turns.speaker: PUG
turns.text: Map is kinda dirty, Monster...

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: They changed the layout.

turns.speaker: PUG
turns.text: Without having them hit the alarms.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: I got an idea on that one. Once you're up there, you gotta hold those guards down till some backup can get there. There's a security camera room that videotapes everything. You've gotta destroy every last one of those tapes.

turns.speaker: MR. BLONDE
turns.text: Alone at last.

turns.speaker: MR. BLONDE
turns.text: Now where were we?

turns.speaker: COP
turns.text: I told you I don't know anything about any fucking set up. I've only been on the force eight months, nobody tells me anything! I don't know anything! You can torture me if you want -

turns.speaker: MR. BLONDE
turns.text: Thanks, don't mind if I do.

turns.speaker: COP
turns.text: Your boss even said there wasn't a set up.

turns.speaker: MR. BLONDE
turns.text: First off, I don't have a boss. Are you clear about that?

turns.speaker: MR. BLONDE
turns.text: I asked you a question. Are you clear about that?

turns.speaker: COP
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: MR. BLONDE
turns.text: Now I'm not gonna bullshit you. I don't really care about what you know or don't know. I'm gonna torture you for awhile regardless. Not to get information, but because torturing a cop amuses me. There's nothing you can say, I've heard it all before. There's nothing you can do. Except pray for a quick death, which you ain't gonna get.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: How ya doin', Toothpick?

turns.speaker: VIC
turns.text: Fine, now.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: I'm sorry man, I shoulda picked you up personally at the pen. This whole week's just been crazy. I've had my head up my ass the entire time.

turns.speaker: VIC
turns.text: Funny you should mention it. That's what your father and I been talkin' about.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: That I should've picked you up?

turns.speaker: VIC
turns.text: No. That your head's been up your ass. I walk through the door and Joe says "Vic, you're back, thank god. Finally somebody who knows what the fuck he's doing. Vic, Vic, Vic, Eddie, my son, is a fuck up." And I say "Well, Joe, I coulda told you that." "I'm ruined! He's ruining me! My son, I love him, but he's taking my business and flushing it down the fuckin' toilet! "  I'm not tellin' tales out of school. You tell 'im Joe. Tell 'im yourself.

turns.speaker: VIC
turns.text: You fuckin' wish.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: You tried to fuck me in my father's office, you sick bastard. Look, Vic, whatever you wanna do in the privacy of your own home, go do it. But don't try to fuck me. I don't think of you that way. I mean, I like you a lot -

turns.speaker: VIC
turns.text: Eddie, if I was a pirate, I wouldn't throw you to the crew.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: No, you'd keep me for yourself. Four years fuckin' punks in the ass made you appreciate prime rib when you get it.

turns.speaker: VIC
turns.text: I might break you, Nice Guy, but I'd make you my dog's bitch. You'd be suckin' the dick and going down on a mangy T-bone hound.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Now ain't that a sad sight, daddy, walks into jail a white man, walks out talkin' like a nigger. It's all that black semen been shootin' up his butt. It's backed up into his brain and comes out of his mouth.

turns.speaker: VIC
turns.text: Seymour Scagnetti.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Scagnetti? Oh shit, I hear he's a motherfucker.

turns.speaker: VIC
turns.text: He is a motherfucker. He won't let me leave the halfway house till I get some piece of shit job.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: You're coming back to work for us, right?

turns.speaker: VIC
turns.text: I wanna. But I gotta show this asshole I got an honest-to-goodness job before he'll let me move out on my own. I can't work for you guys and be worried about gettin' back before ten o'clock curfew.

turns.speaker: VIC
turns.text: I don't wanna lift crates.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: You don't hafta lift shit. You don't really work there. But as far as the records are concerned, you do. I call up Matthews, the foreman, tell him he's got a new guy. You're on the schedule. You got a timecard, it's clocked in and out for you everyday, and you get a pay check at the end of the week. And ya know dock workers don't do too bad. So you can move into a halfway decent place without Scagnetti thinkin "what the fuck." And if Scagnetti ever wants to make a surprise visit, you're gone that day. That day we sent you to Tustin. We gotta bunch of shit you needed to unload there. You're at the Taft airstrip pickin' up a bunch of shit and bringing it back. Part of your job is goin' different places - and we got places all over the place.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Holy shit, this guy's all fucked up!

turns.speaker: MR. WHITE
turns.text: No shit, he's gonna fuckin' die on us if we don't get him taken care of.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Jesus Christ, give me a fuckin' chance to breathe. I got a few questions of my own, ya know.

turns.speaker: MR. WHITE
turns.text: You ain't dying, he is.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: I'll call somebody.

turns.speaker: MR. WHITE
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: A snake charmer, what the fuck d'you think. I'll call a doctor, take care of him, fix 'm right up. No, where's Mr. Brown and Mr. Blue?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Let me tell you guys a story. In one of daddy's clubs there was this black cocktail waitress named Elois.

turns.speaker: MR. WHITE
turns.text: Elois?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Yeah, Elois. E and Lois. We called her Lady E.

turns.speaker: MR. WHITE
turns.text: Where was she from, Compton?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: No. She was from Ladora Heights.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: I don't know what he did to her, but she got even.

turns.speaker: MR. WHITE
turns.text: Was he all pissed off?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: I don't buy it. It doesn't make sense.

turns.speaker: MR. WHITE
turns.text: It makes perfect fuckin' sense to me. Eddie, you didn't see how he acted during the job, we did.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: The motherfucker killed Vic.

turns.speaker: MR. WHITE
turns.text: How do you know all this?

turns.speaker: MR. WHITE
turns.text: Joe, you're making a terrible mistake I can't let you make.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Stop pointing your fuckin' gun at daddy!

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Daddy, did ya see that?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Guy got me on the ground, tried to fuck me.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Now Vic was tellin' me, he's got a parole problem.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Really? Who's your P.O.?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: We can work this out, can't we?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: This isn't all that bad. We can give you a lot of legitimate jobs. Put you on the rotation at Long Beach as a dock worker.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Didn't I tell ya not to worry?  Vic was worried.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Me and you'll drive down to Long Beach tomorrow. I'll introduce you to Matthews, tell him what's going on.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Nuts. We got a big meeting in Vegas coming up. And we're kinda just gettin ready for that right now.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Let Nice Guy set you up at Long Beach. Give ya some cash, get that Scagnetti fuck off your back, and we'll be talking to ya.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Daddy, I got an idea. Now just hear it out. I know you don't like to use any of the boys on these jobs, but technically, Vic ain't one of the boys. He's been gone for four years. He ain't on no one's list. Ya know he can handle himself, ya know you can trust him.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Daddy, I'm sorry, I don't know what's happening.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: That's okay, Eddie, I do.

turns.speaker: MR. PINK
turns.text: We were set up, the cops were waiting for us.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: What? Nobody set anybody up.

turns.speaker: MR. PINK
turns.text: The cops were there waitin' for us!

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Bullshit.

turns.speaker: MR. PINK
turns.text: Hey, fuck you man, you weren't there, we were. And I'm tellin' ya, the cops had that store staked out.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Okay, Mr. Detective, who did it?

turns.speaker: MR. PINK
turns.text: What the fuck d'you think we've been askin' each other?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: And what are your answers? Was it me? You think I set you up?

turns.speaker: MR. PINK
turns.text: I don't know, but somebody did.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Nobody did. You assholes turn the jewelry store into a wild west show, and you wonder why cops show up.

turns.speaker: MR. PINK
turns.text: Brown's dead, we don't know about Blue.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Nobody saw what happened to Mr. Blue?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: I take it this is the bastard you told me about.  Why the hell are you beating on him?

turns.speaker: MR. PINK
turns.text: So he'll tell us who the fuck set us up.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Would you stop it with that shit! You beat on this prick enough, he'll tell ya he started the Chicago fire. That don't necessarily make it so. Okay, first things fucking last, where's the shit? Please tell me somebody brought something with them.

turns.speaker: MR. PINK
turns.text: I got a bag. I stashed it till I could be sure this place wasn't a police station.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Well, let's go get it. We also gotta get rid of all those cars. It looks like Sam's hot car lot outside.  You stay here and babysit Orange and the cop.  You two take a car each, I'll follow ya. You ditch it, I'll pick you up, then we'll pick up the stones. And while I'm following you, I'll arrange for some sort of a doctor for our friend.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: What does it matter who stays with the cop? We ain't lettin' him go. Not after he's seen everybody. You should've never took him outta your trunk in the first place.

turns.speaker: MR. PINK
turns.text: We were trying to find out what he knew about the set up.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: There is no fuckin' set up!  Look, this is the news. Blondie, you stay here and take care of them two. White and Pink come with me, 'cuz if Joe gets here and sees all those fucking cars parked out front, he's going to be as mad at me as he is at you.

turns.speaker: MR. PINK
turns.text: Go ahead and laugh, you know what I mean. What a while bitch will put up with, a black bitch won't put up with for a minute. They got a line, and if you cross it, they fuck you up.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: I gotta go along with Mr. Pink on this. I've seen it happen.

turns.speaker: MR. PINK
turns.text: The black Beverly Hills. I knew this lady from Ladora Heights once.  "Hi, I'm from Ladora Heights, it's the black Beverly Hills."

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: It's not the black Beverly Hills, it's the black Palos Verdes. Anyway, this chick, Elois, was a man-eater- upper. I bet every guy who's ever met her has jacked off to her at least once. You know who she looked like? Christie Love. 'Member that TV show "Get Christie Love"? She was a black female cop. She always used to say "You're under arrest, sugar."

turns.speaker: MR. PINK
turns.text: I was in the sixth grade when that show was on. I totally dug it. What the fuck was the name of the chick who played Christie Love?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Pam Grier.

turns.speaker: MR. PINK
turns.text: No, it wasn't Pam Grier, Pam Grier was the other one. Pam Grier made the movies. Christie Love was like a Pam Grier TV show, without Pam Grier.

turns.speaker: MR. PINK
turns.text: What the fuck was that chick's name? Oh this is just great, I'm totally fuckin' tortured now.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Well, whoever she was, Elois looked like her. So one night I walk into the club, and no Elois. Now the bartender was a wetback, he was a friend of mine, his name was Carlos. So I asked him "Hey, Carlos, where's Lady E tonight?" Well apparently Lady E was married to this real piece of dog shit. I mean a real animal. And apparently he would so things to her.

turns.speaker: MR. PINK
turns.text: He's right about the ear, it's hacked off.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Let me say this out loud, just to get it straight in my mind. According to you, Mr. Blonde was gonna kill you. Then when we came back, kill us, grab the diamonds, and scram. That's your story? I'm correct about that, right?

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: Say "hello" to a motherfucker who's inside. Cabot's doing a job and take a big fat guess who he wants on the team?

turns.speaker: HOLDAWAY
turns.text: This better not be some Freddy joke.

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: Nice Guy. When we got to the bar...

turns.speaker: HOLDAWAY
turns.text: ...What bar?

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: The Boots and Socks in Gardena. When we got there, I met Joe and a guy named Mr. White. It's a phony name. My name's Mr. Orange.

turns.speaker: HOLDAWAY
turns.text: You ever seen this motherfucker before?

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: Who, Mr. White?

turns.speaker: HOLDAWAY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: No, he ain't familiar. He ain't one of Cabot's soldiers either. He's gotta be from outta town. But Joe knows him real well.

turns.speaker: HOLDAWAY
turns.text: How can you tell?

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: The way they talk to each other. You can tell they're buddies.

turns.speaker: HOLDAWAY
turns.text: Did the two of you talk?

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: Me and Mr. White?

turns.speaker: HOLDAWAY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: A little.

turns.speaker: HOLDAWAY
turns.text: What about?

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: The Brewers.

turns.speaker: HOLDAWAY
turns.text: The Milwaukee Brewers?

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: Yeah. They had just won the night before, and he made a killing off 'em.

turns.speaker: HOLDAWAY
turns.text: Well, if this crook's a Brewers fan, his ass has gotta be from Wisconsin. And I'll bet you everything from a diddle-eyed Joe to a damned-if-I- know, that in Milwaukee they got a sheet on this Mr. White motherfucker's ass. I want you to go through the mugs of guys from old Milwaukee with a history of armed robbery, and put a name to that face.

turns.speaker: HOLDAWAY
turns.text: What kinds questions did Cabot ask?

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: Where I was from, who I knew, how I knew Nice Guy, had I done time, shit like that.

turns.speaker: HOLDAWAY
turns.text: Didja use the commode story?

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: Fuckin' A. I tell it real good, too.

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: What's this?

turns.speaker: HOLDAWAY
turns.text: It's a scene. Memorize it.

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: HOLDAWAY
turns.text: A undercover cop has got to be Marlon Brando. To do this job you got to be a great actor. You got to be naturalistic. You got to be naturalistic as hell. If you ain't a great actor you're a bad actor, and bad acting is bullshit in this job.

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: But what is this?

turns.speaker: HOLDAWAY
turns.text: It's a amusing anecdote about a drug deal.

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: HOLDAWAY
turns.text: Something funny that happened to you while you were doing a job.

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: I gotta memorize all this shit?

turns.speaker: HOLDAWAY
turns.text: It's like a joke. You remember what's important, and the rest you make your own. The only way to make it your own is to keep sayin' it, and sayin' it, and sayin' it, and sayin' it, and sayin' it.

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: I can do that.

turns.speaker: HOLDAWAY
turns.text: The things you gotta remember are the details. It's the details that sell your story. Now this story takes place in this men's room. So you gotta know the details about this men's room. You gotta know they got a blower instead of a towel to dry your hands. You gotta know the stalls ain't got no doors. You gotta know whether they got liquid or powdered soap, whether they got hot water or not, 'cause if you do your job when you tell your story, everybody should believe it. And if you tell your story to somebody who's actually taken a piss in this men's room, and you get one detail they remember right, they'll swear by you.

turns.speaker: HOLDAWAY
turns.text: Tell me more about Cabot.

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: He's a cool guy. A real nice, real funny, real cool guy.

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: ...Her brother usually goes with her, but he's in county unexpectedly.

turns.speaker: MR. WHITE
turns.text: What for?

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: Traffic tickets gone to warrant. They stopped him for something, found the warrants on 'im, took 'im to jail. She doesn't want to walk around alone with all that weed. Well, I don't wanna do this, I have a bad feeling about it, but she keeps askin' me, keeps askin' me, finally I said okay 'cause I'm sick of listening to it. Well, we're picking this guy up at the train station.

turns.speaker: MR. WHITE
turns.text: Jesus Christ!

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: You can do some crazy things with it.

turns.speaker: MR. WHITE
turns.text: Let's go over it. Where are you?

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: I stand outside and guard the door. I don't let anybody come in or go out.

turns.speaker: MR. WHITE
turns.text: Mr. Brown?

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: Mr. Brown stays in the car. He's parked across the street till I give him the signal, then he pulls up in front of the store.

turns.speaker: MR. WHITE
turns.text: Mr. Blonde and Mr. Blue?

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: Crowd control. They handle customers and employees in the display area.

turns.speaker: MR. WHITE
turns.text: Myself and Mr. Pink?

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: You two take the manager in the back and make him give you the diamonds. We're there for those stones, period. Since no display cases are being fucked with, no alarms should go off. We're out of there in two minutes, not one second longer. What if the manager won't give up the diamonds?

turns.speaker: MR. WHITE
turns.text: When you're dealing with a store like this, they're insured up the ass. They're not supposed to give you and resistance whatsoever. If you get a customer or an employee who thinks he's Charles Bronson, take the butt of your gun and smash their nose in. Drops 'em right to the floor. Everyone jumps, he falls down, screaming, blood squirts out his nose. Freaks everybody out. Nobody says fuckin' shit after that. You might get some bitch talk shit to ya. But give her a look, like you're gonna smash her in the face next. Watch her shut the fuck up. Now if it's a manager, that's a different story. The managers know better than to fuck around. So if one's givin' you static, he probably thinks he's a real cowboy. So what you gotta do is break that son-of-a-bitch in two. If you wanna know something and he won't tell you, cut off one of his fingers. The little one. Then you tell 'im his thumb's next. After that he'll tell ya if he wears ladies underwear. I'm hungry, let's get a taco.

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: MR. WHITE
turns.text: What? Snap out of it!

turns.speaker: MR. WHITE
turns.text: Just hold on buddy boy.

turns.speaker: FREDDY
turns.text: I'm sorry. I can't believe she killed me...

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: How's freedom kid, pretty fuckin' good, ain't it?

turns.speaker: VIC
turns.text: It's a change.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Ain't that a sad truth. Remy Martin?

turns.speaker: VIC
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Take a seat.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Who's your parole officer?

turns.speaker: VIC
turns.text: A guy named Scagnetti. Seymour Scagnetti.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: How is he?

turns.speaker: VIC
turns.text: Fuckin' asshole, won't let me leave the halfway house.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Never ceases to amaze me. Fuckin' jungle bunny goes out there, slits some old woman's throat for twenty- five cents. Fuckin' nigger gets Doris Day as a parole officer. But a good fella like you gets stuck with a ball-bustin' prick.

turns.speaker: VIC
turns.text: I just want you to know, Joe, how much I appreciate your care packages on the inside.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: What the hell did you expect me to do? Just forget about you?

turns.speaker: VIC
turns.text: I just wanted you to know, they meant a lot.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: It's the least I could do Vic. I wish I coulda done more.  Vic. Toothpick Vic. Tell me a story? What're your plans?

turns.speaker: VIC
turns.text: Well, what I wanna do is go back to work. But I got this Scagnetti prick deep up my ass. He won't let me leave the halfway house till I get some piece of shit job. My plans have always been to be part of the team again.

turns.speaker: VIC
turns.text: That's great, guy, thanks a bunch.  When do you think you'll need me for real work?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Well, it's kinda a strange time right now. Things are kinda -

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Toby... who the fuck is Toby? Toby... Toby... think... think... think...

turns.speaker: MR. BROWN
turns.text: It's not about a nice girl who meets a sensitive boy. Now granted that's what "True Blue" is about, no argument about that.

turns.speaker: MR. BROWN
turns.text: Hey, fuck all that, I'm making a point here. You're gonna make me lose my train of thought.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Oh fuck, Toby's that little china girl.

turns.speaker: MR. BROWN
turns.text: Then one day she meets a John Holmes motherfucker, and it's like, whoa baby. This mother fucker's like Charles Bronson in "The Great Escape." He's diggin' tunnels. Now she's gettin' this serious dick action, she's feelin' something she ain't felt since forever. Pain.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Chew? Toby Chew? No.

turns.speaker: MR. BROWN
turns.text: It hurts. It hurts her. It shouldn't hurt. Her pussy should be Bubble-Yum by now. But when this cat fucks her, it hurts. It hurts like the first time. The pain is reminding a fuck machine what is was like to be a virgin. Hence, "Like a Virgin."

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Wong?

turns.speaker: MR. BROWN
turns.text: Fuck you, wrong. I'm right! What the fuck do you know about it anyway? You're still listening to Jerry- fucking-Vale.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Not wrong, dumb ass, Wong! You know, like the Chinese name?

turns.speaker: MR. PINK
turns.text: Because you paid for the breakfast, I'm gonna tip. Normally I wouldn't.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Whatever. Just throw in your dollar, and let's move.  See what I'm dealing with here. Infants. I'm fuckin' dealin' with infants.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: But he's OK. If he wasn't OK, he wouldn't be here. Okay, let me introduce everybody to everybody. But once again, at the risk of being redundant, if I even think I hear somebody telling or referring to somebody by their Christian name...  ...you won't want to be you. Okay, quickly.  Mr. Brown, Mr. White, Mr. Blonde, Mr. Blue, Mr. Orange, and Mr. Pink.

turns.speaker: MR. PINK
turns.text: Why am I Mr. Pink?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Cause you're a faggot, alright?

turns.speaker: MR. PINK
turns.text: Why can't we pick out our own colors?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: I tried that once, it don't work. You get four guys fighting over who's gonna be Mr. Black. Since nobody knows anybody else, nobody wants to back down. So forget it, I pick. Be thankful you're not Mr. Yellow.

turns.speaker: MR. PINK
turns.text: Yeah, Mr. Pink sounds like Mr. Pussy. Tell you what, let me be Mr. Purple. That sounds good to me, I'm Mr. Purple.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: You're not Mr. Purple, somebody from another job's Mr. Purple. You're Mr. Pink.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Nobody's trading with anybody! Look, this ain't a goddamn fuckin' city counsel meeting! Listen up Mr. Pink. We got two ways here, my way or the highway. And you can go down either of 'em. So what's it gonna be, Mr. Pink?

turns.speaker: MR. PINK
turns.text: Jesus Christ, Joe. Fuckin' forget it. This is beneath me. I'm Mr. Pink, let's move on.

turns.speaker: MR. PINK
turns.text: Mr. Blue's dead?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Dead as Dillinger.

turns.speaker: MR. WHITE
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: I found this old address book in a jacket I ain't worn in a coon's age. Toby what? What the fuck was her last name?

turns.speaker: MR. WHITE
turns.text: Give me this fucking thing.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: What the fuck do you think you're doin'? Give me my book back!

turns.speaker: MR. WHITE
turns.text: I'm sick of fuckin' hearin' it Joe; I'll give it back when we leave.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Whaddaya mean, give it to me when we leave, give it back now.

turns.speaker: MR. WHITE
turns.text: For the past fifteen minutes now, you've just been droning on with names. "Toby... Toby... Toby... Toby Wong... Toby Wong... Toby Chung... fuckin' Charlie Chan." I got Madonna's big dick outta my right ear, and Toby Jap I-don't-know-what, outta my left.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: What do you care?

turns.speaker: MR. WHITE
turns.text: When you're annoying as hell, I care a lot.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Give me my book.

turns.speaker: MR. WHITE
turns.text: You gonna put it away?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: I'm gonna do whatever I wanna do with it.

turns.speaker: MR. WHITE
turns.text: Well, then, I'm afraid I'm gonna have to keep it.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: No, she did it. She killed the cheatin' wife, too.

turns.speaker: MR. WHITE
turns.text: Who gives a damn?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: I'll take care of this, you guys leave the tip.  And when I come back, I want my book back.

turns.speaker: MR. WHITE
turns.text: Sorry, it's my book now.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Blonde, shoot this piece of shit, will ya?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: What's she doin' now?

turns.speaker: MR. WHITE
turns.text: She hooked up with Fed McGar, they've done a couple a jobs together. Good little thief. So, explain the telegram.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Five-man job. Bustin' in and bustin' out of a diamond wholesaler's.

turns.speaker: MR. WHITE
turns.text: Can you move the ice afterwards? I don't know nobody who can move ice.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Not a problem, got guys waitin' for it. But what happened to Marsellus Spivey? Didn't he always move your ice?

turns.speaker: MR. WHITE
turns.text: He's doin' twenty years in Susanville.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: What for?

turns.speaker: MR. WHITE
turns.text: Bad luck. What's the exposure like?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Two minutes, tops. It's a tough two minutes. It's daylight, during business hours, dealing with a crowd. But you'll have the guys to deal with the crowd.

turns.speaker: MR. WHITE
turns.text: How many employees?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Around twenty. Security pretty lax. They almost always just deal in boxes. Rough uncut stones they get from the syndicate. On a certain day this wholesaler's gettin' a big shipment of polished stones from Israel. They're like a way station. They are gonna get picked up the next day and sent to Vermont.

turns.speaker: MR. WHITE
turns.text: No, they're not.

turns.speaker: MR. WHITE
turns.text: What's the cut, poppa?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Juicy, junior, real juicy.

turns.speaker: MR. WHITE
turns.text: What the fuck are you talking about?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: That piece of shit. Workin' with the cops.

turns.speaker: MR. WHITE
turns.text: Joe, I don't know what you think you know, but you're wrong.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Like hell I am.

turns.speaker: MR. WHITE
turns.text: Joe, trust me on this, you've made a mistake. He's a good kid. I understand you're hot, you're super-fuckin' pissed. We're all real emotional. But you're barking up the wrong tree. I know this man, and he wouldn't do that.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: You don't know jack shit. I do. This rotten bastard tipped off the cops and got Mr. Brown and Mr. Blue killed.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: He was the only one I wasn't a hundred percent on. I should have my fucking head examined for goin' forward when I wasn't a hundred percent. But he seemed like a good kid, and I was impatient and greedy and all the things that fuck you up.

turns.speaker: MR. WHITE
turns.text: That's your proof?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: You don't need proof when you got instinct. I ignored it before, but not no more.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Don't worry, Eddie. Me and Larry have been friends a long time, he ain't gonna shoot. We like each other too much.

turns.speaker: MR. WHITE
turns.text: Joe, if you kill that man, you die next. Repeat, if you kill that man, you die next!

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Larry, I'm gonna kill him.

turns.speaker: MR. WHITE
turns.text: Goddamn you, Joe, don't make me do this!

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Larry, I'm askin' you to trust me on this.

turns.speaker: MR. WHITE
turns.text: Don't ask me that.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: I'm not askin', I'm betting.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Okay ramblers, let's get to rambling. Wait a minute, who didn't throw in?

turns.speaker: MR. ORANGE
turns.text: Mr. Pink.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Mr. Pink?  Why?

turns.speaker: MR. ORANGE
turns.text: He don't tip.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: He don't tip?  You don't tip? Why?

turns.speaker: MR. ORANGE
turns.text: He don't believe in it.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: He don't believe in it?  You don't believe in it?

turns.speaker: MR. ORANGE
turns.text: Nope.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Shut up!  Cough up the buck, ya cheap bastard, I paid for your goddamn breakfast.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Aren't you?

turns.speaker: MR. ORANGE
turns.text: I don't have the slightest fuckin' idea what you're talkin' about.

turns.speaker: MARVIN
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: MR. ORANGE
turns.text: You do?

turns.speaker: MARVIN
turns.text: Your name's Freddy something.

turns.speaker: MR. ORANGE
turns.text: Freddy Newendyke.

turns.speaker: MARVIN
turns.text: Frankie Ferchetti introduced us once, about five months ago.

turns.speaker: MR. ORANGE
turns.text: Shit. I don't remember that at all.

turns.speaker: MARVIN
turns.text: I do.  How do I look?

turns.speaker: MARVIN
turns.text: That fucking bastard! That fucking sick fucking bastard!

turns.speaker: MR. ORANGE
turns.text: Marvin, I need you to hold on. There's officers positioned and waiting to move in a block away.

turns.speaker: MARVIN
turns.text: What the fuck are they waiting for? That motherfucker cut off my ear! He slashed my face! I'm deformed!

turns.speaker: MR. ORANGE
turns.text: And I'm dying. They don't know that. All they know is they're not to make a move until Joe Cabot shows up. I was sent undercover to get Cabot. You heard 'em, they said he's on his way. Don't pussy out on me now, Marvin. We're just gonna sit here and bleed until Joe Cabot sticks his fuckin' head through that door.

turns.speaker: MR. BLONDE
turns.text: Joe, you want me to shoot him for you?

turns.speaker: MR. WHITE
turns.text: Shit, you shoot me in a dream, you better wake up and apologize.

turns.speaker: MR. BLONDE
turns.text: So, talk.

turns.speaker: MR. WHITE
turns.text: We think we got a rat in the house.

turns.speaker: MR. BLONDE
turns.text: What's this guy's problem?

turns.speaker: MR. WHITE
turns.text: What's my problem? Yeah, I gotta problem. I gotta big problem with any trigger-happy madman who almost gets me shot!

turns.speaker: MR. BLONDE
turns.text: What're you talkin' about?

turns.speaker: MR. WHITE
turns.text: That fuckin' shooting spree in the store.

turns.speaker: MR. BLONDE
turns.text: Fuck 'em, they set off the alarm, they deserve what they got.

turns.speaker: MR. WHITE
turns.text: You almost killed me, asshole! If I had any idea what type of guy you were, I never would've agreed to work with you.

turns.speaker: MR. BLONDE
turns.text: You gonna bark all day, little doggie, or are you gonna bite?

turns.speaker: MR. WHITE
turns.text: What was that? I'm sorry, I didn't catch it. Would you repeat it?

turns.speaker: MR. BLONDE
turns.text: I said: "Are you gonna bark all day, dog, or are you gonna bite."

turns.speaker: MR. WHITE
turns.text: Follow you where?

turns.speaker: MR. BLONDE
turns.text: Down to my car.

turns.speaker: MR. WHITE
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: MR. BLONDE
turns.text: It's a surprise.

turns.speaker: MR. WHITE
turns.text: For what, the cops?

turns.speaker: MR. BLONDE
turns.text: Nice Guy Eddie.

turns.speaker: MR. WHITE
turns.text: You talked to Nice Guy Eddie? Why the fuck didn't you say that in the first place?

turns.speaker: MR. BLONDE
turns.text: You didn't ask.

turns.speaker: MR. WHITE
turns.text: Hardy-fuckin-har. What did he say?

turns.speaker: MR. BLONDE
turns.text: Stay put. Okay, fellas, take a look at the little surprise I brought you.

turns.speaker: MR. WHITE
turns.text: Because this guy's a fucking psycho. And if you think Joe's pissed at us, that ain't nothing compared to how pissed off I am at him, for puttin' me in the same room as this bastard.

turns.speaker: MR. BLONDE
turns.text: You see what I been puttin' up with? As soon as I walk through the door I'm hit with this shit. I tell 'm what you told me about us stayin' put and Mr. White whips out his gun, sticks it in my face, and starts screaming "You motherfucker, I'm gonna blow you away, blah, blah, blah."

turns.speaker: MR. WHITE
turns.text: He's the reason the place turned into a shooting gallery.  What are you, a silent partner? Fuckin' tell him.

turns.speaker: MR. BLONDE
turns.text: I told 'em not to touch the alarm. They touched it. I blew 'em full of holes. If they hadn't done what I told 'em not it, they'd still be alive.

turns.speaker: MR. WHITE
turns.text: That's your excuse for going on a kill crazy rampage?

turns.speaker: MR. BLONDE
turns.text: I don't like alarms.
